locale.name: en_US
locale.message: This schema supports the MODS metadata format.
A unique standard number or code that distinctively identifies a resource
A word, phrase, character, or group of characters that constitutes the chief title of a resource
A word, phrase, character, or group of characters that contains the remainder of the title information after the title proper
Used for a part or section number of a title
Includes each part of the name that is parsed
Used for a part or section name of a title
Begin and end tags surround the nonfiling text which should not be regarded in sorting
The name of an organization, institution, etc. with which the entity recorded was associated at the time that the resource was created
A term(s) that designates the relationship (role) of the entity recorded in name in relation to the resource
Contains the textual or coded form of a relator/role
A term that specifies the characteristics and general type of content of the resource
A term(s) that designates a category characterizing a particular style, form, or content, such as artistic, musical, literary composition, etc.
Used to express place in a textual or coded form
The name of the entity that published, printed, distributed, released, issued, or produced the resource
The date that the resource was published, released or issued
The date of creation of the resource
The date on which the resource was digitized or a subsequent snapshot was taken
A date in which the content of a resource is valid
A date in which a resource is modified or changed
A date in which a resource is copyrighted
A date that does not fall into another category but is important to record
The date on which the record was first created
May serve as a version identifier for the record
Information identifying the edition or version to which the resource belongs
A term that designates how the resource is issued
A statement of publication frequency in a textual form
Contains the language(s) of the content of the resource
A designation of a particular physical presentation of a resource
A term that indicates an overall assessment of the physical quality of an electronic resource in relation to its intended use
An identification of the electronic format type, or the data representation of the resource
A statement of the number and specific material of the units of the resource that express physical extent
A designation of the source of a digital file important to its creation, use and management
General textual information about the physical description of a resource
A summary of the content of the resource
A description of the contents of a resource
A description of the intellectual level of the audience for which the resource is intended
Used as the tag for any topical subjects that are not appropriate in the geographic, temporal, title info, or name fields
Used for geographic subject terms that are not parsed as hierarchical geographics
Used for chronological subject terms or temporal coverage
Includes a geographic area code associated with a resource
Includes Asia, Africa, Europe, North America, South America
Includes a country, i.e. a political entity considered a country
Includes first order political divisions called provinces within a country, e.g. Canada
Includes regions that have status as a jurisdiction, usually incorporating more than one first level jurisdiction
Includes first order political divisions called states within a country, e.g. in U.S., Argentina, Italy. Use also for France département
A geographical area belonging to or under the jurisdiction of a governmental authority
Includes the largest local administrative unit in various countries, e.g. England
Use for an inhabited place incorporated as a city, town, etc.
Use for a tract of land surrounded by water and smaller than a continent but is not itself a separate country
Use for a non-jurisdictional geographic entity
Contains a statement of coordinates covered by the resource
Includes a term that is descriptive of the occupation reflected in the contents of the described materials
A designation applied to a resource that indicates the subject by applying a formal system of coding and organizing resources according to subject areas
The institution or repository holding the resource or from which it is available
The Uniform Resource Location from which the resource is available
Information about restrictions imposed on access to a resource
Used to provide for additional information not covered by MODS
The code or name of the organization that either created or modified the original record
Contains the system control number assigned by the organization creating, using, or distributing the record
Intended to show the origin, or provenance of the MODS record
Applies to the language of cataloging in a record
General textual information relating to a resource
